Again Kiki has always made us feel so very welcome.  You have a good employee with her.

I go to Anthonys when I'm in the mood for a pizza like no other around.  the use fresh ingredients and have unique blends.  Their pizza is cooked in coal fired ovens which cooks the pizza in just minutes.  The chicken wings are tops as they are dry cooked in the coal ovens with onions.  They are so so good.  The meatballs are top as well.  Cold craft beer, good spirits and exceptionally friendly staff.  The manager always comes around and checks to make sure that everything is to my liking. name: Bryan Hayward
text: The food is not your typical sports bar/pizza place. The atmosphere is misleading.   You think you're going into (yet another)  "pizza place" that is really a sports bar.   However,  the food is *amazing*.  The ingredients are top notch.   The wings are actually flavorful,  not just drowned in dressing or hot sauce (in fact, they aren't normally served with any coating).  They come skillfully marinated,  naked, and grilled with onions.   The pizza ingredients are fresh and though the crust is crunchy,  the ingredients still taste like their fresh counterparts without being overcooked.   The sandwiches are delightfully green (including arugula and basil) and yet satisfying for carnivores.  The cannolis are tasty all the way through,  from the handmade filling to the crunchy and flaky  shell.  The service was outstanding. The only reason it isn't 5-star is the sports bar atmosphere.

name: Elvin Berndt
text:
I have eaten at several of Anthony's locations and always had great service and great food.  This location was by far the worst dinning experiences I have ever had.  Our family went there while visiting our daughter at college and wanted to have dinner before driving back.

We ordered a salad, 4 meatballs, a pizza and a chicken sandwich.  The salad came out no problem.  After about 25 minutes later I asked a waiter if he could check on our food.  After about 10 minutes our original waiter returned and said our pizza would be out shortly because they ran out of meatballs for the pizza?  They said meatballs where their signature dish and that is what they were known for....

We finally got our pizza about 50 minutes after ordering with our daughters chicken sandwich being served 5 minutes later.  The waiter again apologized and said the manager would be be over to talk to us.  I said I would prefer to not speak with manager and that we just wanted to eat our pizza and get on our way.  As we began to eat, a young man who identified himself as the manager came over and said " so what's up" I told him I would prefer to not speak with him and that we just wanted to eat our meal.  He continued to stand next to me and ask why.  I again turned and said you know what the issue is and we would just prefer to be left alone so we could eat.  He continued to probe and I finally said that the problem was the service and I would prefer not to discuss it.  We continued our meal and women named Vanessa (who also identified herself as the manager) came to the table and asked if she could assist.  I told her I just wanted my bill.  Her and the staff stood across the room, and based on the fact they all kept looking at us I can only assume we were the topic of their discussion.  When she returned, she asked one of my guest if there was a problem.  My guest said no, why do you ask.  She said I saw you staring at me so I thought you had a problem.

Bottom line, this location has poor leadership which resulted in a terrible customer experience, mediocore food and has lost Anthony's a customer for life.

PS... After ackowledging their service issues, neither manager offered any kind of courtesy discount to try and appease our group.  No problem... You have seen the last of our money.

name: Ashton Weinberger
text:
My boyfriend and I were looking forward to the opening of this new location near us, but ended up having a very unimpressive and unsatisfying experience.

The website advertises that Anthony's has local craft beers on draft. WRONG! We sat at the bar, and read the draft list written on the chalkboard on the wall, and let me tell you something, Red Hook and Angry Orchard ARE NOT LOCAL CRAFT BEERS! There were about 3 beers listed that were local, but what do you know? THEY WERE COMPLETELY OUT OF ALL OF THEM. Hey I got an idea guys, instead of trying to be cute and trendy by writing your draft list on a chalkboard, take it to the next step AND ERASE THE BEER THAT YOU RUN OUT OF! This will save a lot of time for everyone, and won't get anyone's hopes up.

We ended up ordering Peronis (NOT LOCAL CRAFT BEER) and a pizza. Unfortunately, the pizza took 40 minutes to come out, and half of it was burned to a crisp and inedible. Maybe this explains the "Pizza Well Done" disclaimers printed all over the walls?

The pizza we ordered was the Paul & Young Ron with the choice of hot or sweet peppers. We chose the hot pepper option, and the pizza was topped with WHOLE green chilies that had not been sliced, and the seeds and pith (squishy insides) had not been removed. This is an absolutely unacceptable way to serve green chilies and the concept is neither "unique" nor appetizing. Biting into the peppers fills your mouth with seeds and pepper guts that you immediately want to spit out.

Additionally, green chili peppers ARE NOT HOT PEPPERS! We asked the bartender/server what the sweet pepper option was, and she replied that it was red bell peppers. We then asked her if the red bell peppers were served WHOLE on the pizza, but that was over her head.

On top of it all, the speakers BLAST a terrible music selection across every genre, creating the vibe of a washed up karaoke bar lacking any ambiance whatsoever.

We were very disappointed by this restaurant, and would not recommend it.
